code: @Manual{,   title = {opengraph: Process Metadata from the Open Graph Protocol},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://github.com/christopherkenny/opengraph}, }

what: Process Metadata from the Open Graph Protocol
title: Process Metadata from the Open Graph Protocol
text: goal opengraph read process Open Graph Protocol metadata websites.

title: Process Metadata from the Open Graph Protocol
text: can install development version opengraph GitHub :

title: Process Metadata from the Open Graph Protocol
text: relatively simple package. main function og_parse() returns named vector Open Graph metadata found given webpage. package can also read specific Open Graph properties og_property(). Properties can prefixed og: . Open Graph metadata found, og_parse() return empty named vector.
code: library(opengraph) url <- 'https://christophertkenny.com/opengraph/' og_parse(url) #>                                                           title  #>                               "Process the Open Graph Protocol"  #>                                                     description  #> "Parse metadata on websites which use the Open Graph Protocol."  #>                                                           image  #>               "http://christophertkenny.com/opengraph/logo.png" og_property(url, 'og:title') #> [1] "Process the Open Graph Protocol" og_property(url, 'title') #> [1] "Process the Open Graph Protocol" og_parse('https://cran.r-project.org/') #> named character(0)

what: Create Open Graph meta tags — og_create
title: Create Open Graph meta tags — og_create
text: Create Open Graph meta tags

title: Create Open Graph meta tags — og_create
Create Open Graph meta tags — og_create
text: title title object appear within graph type type object, e.g., "video.movie". Depending type specify, properties may also required. image image URL represent object within graph. url canonical URL object used permanent ID graph ... Additional Open Graph properties

title: Create Open Graph meta tags — og_create
text: character vector Open Graph meta tags

title: Create Open Graph meta tags — og_create
code: og_create(   title = 'Process the Open Graph Protocol',   type = 'website',   image = 'http://christophertkenny.com/opengraph/logo.png',   url = 'https://christophertkenny.com/opengraph/',   description = 'Parse metadata on websites which use the Open Graph Protocol.' ) #> [1] "<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"Process the Open Graph Protocol\">"                                     #> [2] "<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"website\">"                                                              #> [3] "<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"http://christophertkenny.com/opengraph/logo.png\">"                     #> [4] "<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"https://christophertkenny.com/opengraph/\">"                              #> [5] "<meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"Parse metadata on websites which use the Open Graph Protocol.\">"

title: Parse Open Graph Metadata — og_parse
code: og_parse('https://www.rstudio.com') #>                                                                                                                                        image  #>                                                               "https://posit.co/wp-content/themes/Posit/dist/images/site-share-image-25.png"  #>                                                                                                                                   image:type  #>                                                                                                                                  "image/jpg"  #>                                                                                                                                  image:width  #>                                       image:height  #>                                                                                                                                        "630"  #>                                                                                                                                          url  #>                       title  #>                                                                                                                                      "Posit"  #>                                                                                                                                       locale  #>                                                                                                                                      "en_US"  #>                                                                                                                                         type  #>                                                                                                                                    "website"  #>                                                                                                                                        title  #>                                                                                               "Posit | The Open-Source Data Science Company"  #>                                                                                                                                  description  #> "The best data science is open source. Posit is committed to creating incredible open-source tools for individuals, teams, and enterprises."  #>                                                                                                                                          url  #>                                                                                                                          "https://posit.co/"  #>                                                                                                                                    site_name  #>                                                                                                                                      "Posit"
